title: 【We Connect】平野鈴子幫香港手足錄咗條日文文宣！

replies.msg:
成條片差唔多五分鐘，多謝日本人支持香港之餘，亦清晰講出中共點樣呃哂全世界！

快啲去YouTube、Twitter、IG spread比日本朋友睇！

記得要去多謝平野鈴子！




https://youtu.be/0o1BAs65Bbs

Twitter同IG都要推呀，特別係Twitter!!

https://twitter.com/hkpostmanchann1/status/1249227089292582920?s=21

https://www.instagram.com/tv/B-3yqZCF-ml/?igshid=1wdashjdm87a2

想同大家講句，就算無人做全球登報，我地都要靠自己。就算你唔Share呢條片，都請你一定要盡做！

一齊光復香港，一定要。

全文：

親愛なる日本の友人たちへ

お元気ですか？ コロナウイルスと闘っている日本と他の国々にとって、ここ数週間の生活は楽ではありませんでした。

私はいつもあなた方の傍にいます。どうか頑張って、御自愛下さいませ。

SARSと多数のインフルエンザのパンデミックを経験した香港人は、コロナウイルスの危機に気づいた最初のグループの1つでした。

ほとんどの西洋人はマスクを不要と見なしていますが、それらはウイルスに対する効果的であることを私たちは知っています。防護機能のある眼鏡をかけて、マスクが鼻と口を完全に覆うことを確認しつつご着用くださいませ。 常に万全な態勢で挑む方が感染後に謝るよりずっと良いと思います。

確認された症例の数が爆発的な速度で上昇しているのを見ると、中国政府にますます怒りを感じます。もし中国政府がもっと早い段階で世界に情報開示していればこんなパンデミックにはならずに済みました。

私はフェイクニュースを広めた権威者たちに憤怒しています。

全世界がそのような誤った情報に惑わされているということに我慢出来ません。

中国が報告した症例の数は実際より遥かに少ないと思います。その為、コロナウイルスの蔓延が本当はどれほど深刻であるか、我々には知る事が出来ません。

その中で、一度に病院から退院した患者の数が確認された症例の数を超えたことがあり、新たに確認された患者数を公式数字に加算されていないことが明らかになりました。

皮肉なのは、中国政府の所有する出版物が、中国の科学者がワクチンの開発に進歩を遂げたと図々しく報告している事です。ウイルスの起源である中国は、ウイルスに侵害されている国々に援助を提供するできるということを未だにアピールしているのです。

一番困難だったのは誰もこのコロナウイルスが襲ってくることを予想しなかった事です。

そして、コロナウイルスはおそらく最悪の時期に世界を襲ったでしょう。4年に1度の夏季オリンピックが今年の7月日本で開催される予定で、オーストラリアでの山火事は終わったばかり、香港での自由の為の戦いはまだ終わっていません。

以上多々なことが発生していて、これが私があなたに手紙を書いている理由です。 私は、コロナウイルスへの取り組みにおいて香港が日本と共に戦うことを、日本が9ヵ月間の戦いで香港を支援して来た事と同じように宣言します。

私たちはあなたを、多様な困難を乗り越えて来た仲間を信じています。 一緒にこの悲惨な状況を乗り越えて行きましょう。

With love,
A Hongkonger

Our dearest friends from Japan,

How are you doing? Life hasn’t been easy in recent weeks, for Japan and for the rest of the world, as we are all fighting against the coronavirus. My thoughts are with you always, please stay strong and take care of yourself.

Having been through SARS and numerous flu pandemics, Hongkongers were one of the first groups to become aware of the coronavirus. Although most westerners deem masks as unnecessary, we know (and have proven) that they are effective shields against the virus, so bear with the fogged-up glasses and make sure your mask fully covers your nose and mouth. It is always better to be safe than sorry.

As I see the number of confirmed cases climb at a daunting speed, I get angrier at the Chinese government because the outbreak would not have become a pandemic had it informed the world of the virus earlier. I am growing to resent the authorities for spreading fake news. I cannot stand the idea that the whole world is being misled by such false information. In fact China has been reporting much fewer cases only because it has stopped testing people for the coronavirus, hence we will never know how severe the outbreak truly is. Some also noticed that the official numbers don’t add up, as the number of patients discharged from hospitals once exceeded the amount of confirmed cases. Yet various government-owned publications still report that Chinese scientists have made progress in developing vaccines; that China, the very origin of the virus, is capable of providing aid to countries in need.

I suppose the hardest part of it all is that none of us saw the coronavirus coming. It probably hit the world at the worst time possible: the quadrennial summer Olympics is set to take place this July in Tokyo, bushfires in Australia has just ceased, and the fight for freedom in Hong Kong has yet to succeed.

And this is why I am writing to you. I am writing to let you know that Hong Kong is standing with Japan in tackling the coronavirus, the way Japan has been supporting Hong Kong in our nine-month battle. We have faith in you, our fellow warriors who have leapt over hurdles after hurdles. We will get through this together.

With love,
A Hongkonger
Pysh

replies.msg: Pishhhhhh

quote.msg:
Our dearest friends from Japan,

How are you doing? Life hasn’t been easy in recent weeks, for Japan and for the rest of the world, as we are all fighting against the coronavirus. My thoughts are with you always, please stay strong and take care of yourself.

Having been through SARS and numerous flu pandemics, Hongkongers were one of the first groups to become aware of the coronavirus. Although most westerners deem masks as unnecessary, we know (and have proven) that they are effective shields against the virus, so bear with the fogged-up glasses and make sure your mask fully covers your nose and mouth. It is always better to be safe than sorry.

As I see the number of confirmed cases climb at a daunting speed, I get angrier at the Chinese government because the outbreak would not have become a pandemic had it informed the world of the virus earlier. I am growing to resent the authorities for spreading fake news. I cannot stand the idea that the whole world is being misled by such false information. In fact China has been reporting much fewer cases only because it has stopped testing people for the coronavirus, hence we will never know how severe the outbreak truly is. Some also noticed that the official numbers don’t add up, as the number of patients discharged from hospitals once exceeded the amount of confirmed cases. Yet various government-owned publications still report that Chinese scientists have made progress in developing vaccines; that China, the very origin of the virus, is capable of providing aid to countries in need.

I suppose the hardest part of it all is that none of us saw the coronavirus coming. It probably hit the world at the worst time possible: the quadrennial summer Olympics is set to take place this July in Tokyo, bushfires in Australia has just ceased, and the fight for freedom in Hong Kong has yet to succeed.

And this is why I am writing to you. I am writing to let you know that Hong Kong is standing with Japan in tackling the coronavirus, the way Japan has been supporting Hong Kong in our nine-month battle. We have faith in you, our fellow warriors who have leapt over hurdles after hurdles. We will get through this together.

With love,
A Hongkonger
